TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SecurityCallContext extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Describes the chain of callers leading up to the current method call.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the SecurityCallContext class to interrogate the security context of calls to the methods of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.enterpriseservi_21_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_21_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#4](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_21_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a object that describes the caller.
Docs.value: The object that describes the caller.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Callers accesses the `Callers` item in the `ISecurityCallContext` collection in COM+.

Docs.returns: The object that describes the caller.

Docs.summary: Gets a object that describes the security call context.
Docs.value: The object that describes the security call context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The static CurrentCall property is the recommended way to access the security call context.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this method to obtain a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SecurityCallContext> object describing the security context of a method call.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.enterpriseservi_25_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.enterpriseservi_25_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.enterpriseservi_25_1.vb)]

Docs.returns: The object that describes the security call context.

Docs.summary: Gets a object that describes the direct caller of this method.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this method to check the identity of the direct caller of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> method.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#7](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.enterpriseservi_26_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#7](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.enterpriseservi_26_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#7](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.enterpriseservi_26_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool IsCallerInRole(string role) cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies that the direct caller is a member of the specified role.
Docs.returns: if the direct caller is a member of the specified role; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this method to determine if the caller of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> method is in a specified role.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/m-system.enterpriseservi_10_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/m-system.enterpriseservi_10_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#6](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/m-system.enterpriseservi_10_1.vb)]

Docs.value: if the direct caller is a member of the specified role; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Determines whether security checks are enabled in the current context.
Docs.value: if security checks are enabled in the current context; otherwise, .
Docs.returns: if security checks are enabled in the current context; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Verifies that the specified user is in the specified role.

Docs.summary: Gets the value from the collection in COM+.
Docs.value: The value from the collection in COM+.

remarks.format: ## Remarks MinAuthenticationLevel is the least secure authentication level of all callers in the chain.

Docs.returns: The value from the collection in COM+.

Docs.summary: Gets the value from the collection in COM+.
Docs.value: The value from the collection in COM+.

remarks.format: ## Remarks NumCallers is the number of callers in the chain of calls.
